Your request will be forwarded to the relevant County department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the costs, if any, associated with satisfying your request. Again, thank you for using the FOIA Records Center. 

Ingham County

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sullivan County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sullivan County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Samuel Sinyangwe.

title: NC - Historical Fishing and Hunting License and Tag Fees (North Carolina Wildlife Resources Commission)

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: NC - Historical Fishing and Hunting License and Tag Fees (North Carolina Wildlife Resources Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am a researcher interested in fishing and hunting license prices. I would like to obtain annual data on the yearly recreational fishing and hunting license and tag price data from 1990 to present. Specifically, I would like records showing the fees for the following licenses and tags for both residents and nonresidents (where applicable) from 1/1/1990 to 1/12/26 (listed annually, i.e., one fee per license/tag per year from 1990 to 2026). Please also include the agent fee, where applicable. Please provide fees pertaining to adults. In cases of reciprocal pricing agreements with other states, please provide both the special reciprocal prices to residents of those states and the general price to residents of all states without a reciprocal pricing agreement, where necessary.

Department of Environmental Quality - Coastal Fishing
Coastal Recreational Fishing License (Adult) 
Unified Inland/Coastal Recreational Fishing License
Coastal Recreational Fishing Ten-day

Wildlife Resources Commission 
Inland Fishing­ 10-Day
State Inland Fishing
State Hunting 10 Day
State Hunting Annual
Big Game Hunting
Big Game Hunting­ 10-Day
Bear Management E-Stamp
Bear Hunting License (nonresident

If data is not available back to 1990 for one or more of the specified license or tag prices, please provide data from the oldest year on record to present. To what extent license or tag names might have changed, please match to the most similar license or tag, if possible, for continuation purposes. If possible, please provide the data in a table. Thank you for your help.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Christian Hachtman

communications.subject: Hunting and fishing licenses
communications.communication:
Hi,

Attached should be a spreadsheet that provides the data that you requested.

I tried to include the various licenses and permits that fell within your parameters.

Since the prices didn't change much over the years, instead of providing a year-by-year price for each, I gave the price and then the year that price ended. For example, $40.00, 2014; which would mean that that license would cost $40 from whatever the first date that I have recorded until the 2014, that license was $40. If the Year End column shows 9999, then that was the last, or current price, that we have.

There is also Last Year Sold and a First Year Recorded columns, since some of these licenses are no longer available, this should help you with the ranges of prices.

The Old Fee listed is the fee that was charged until 7/1/2023. This is when we  switched over to a hosting contractor. Some licenses didn't have a fee. The New Fee started on 7/1/2023. I don't know how you wanted to break the data down, but for the new fee there is the fee that the agent makes and a transaction fee associated with the license / permit. If the selling agent is WRC or the hosting contractor, then the agent gets $3 and the transaction fee is $2. If it is any other agent, then the agent gets $4 and the transaction fee is $1.

There is a separate tab for the reciprocal pricing. Any state that isn't listed on that tab pays the same amount as the NC fee.

I hope this satisfies your request. If there is anything you need clarified or changed, please let me know.

title: Department of Defense support for TV documentary series "How Did They Fix That?"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Defense support for TV documentary series "How Did They Fix That?"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Department of Defense (DoD) and the production of Season 4 of the TV documentary series "How Did They Fix That?" (2024-2025). Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of DoD and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "How Did They Fix That?," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

Season 4 of "How Did They Fix That?" appears on a list of DoD entertainment industry collaborations released to me through FOIA. The list is attached to this request.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: FOIA Request: Flock

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: FOIA Request: Flock
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Flock Safety or Flock Group that were active any time between 1/1/2020 and 12/07/2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days for records more than 24-months-old, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

m

title: Use of force data (2017-2024) (Bellevue Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Use of force data (2017-2024) (Bellevue Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2024. This data should be in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If this information is not available in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide scans of the underlying use of force reports or (if unavailable) arrest reports.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: P004584-073025
communications.communication:
Dear Samuel Sinyangwe, 
 
Thank you for submitting your request for public records to the City of Bellevue Police Department. Your request was received in our office on 7/30/2025 7:26:52 PM and given the reference number P004584-073025 for tracking purposes. The details of your request are below.  
 
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2024. This data should be in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If this information is not available in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide scans of the underlying use of force reports or (if unavailable) arrest reports.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbellevue-police-department-816%252Fuse-of-force-data-2017-2024-bellevue-police-department-190352%252F%253Femail%253DBPDrecords%252540bellevuewa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAkAtzcGNrnhGpVWwBfWPi9foI%3A1uhIz9%3AMhEpSOgZOiXaIpFsoY0m7uBjXZHF7JUZ7j1BlfCKvLs 
The City must provide a preliminary response to your request within five (5) business days (RCW 42.56.520); the day the request is received does not count as one of the five (5) days. Weekends and holidays observed by the City are also excluded in the calculation. For additional information regarding our response options, please click here: Prompt Response Required. The City of Bellevue has adopted a  Public Records Fee Schedule, please review it for information associated with fees that may be assessed pursuant to your request. 
You may monitor the progress of your request via the link below; you will receive an email when your request has been completed. We thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
City of Bellevue Police Department

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Records Request :: P004584-073025
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line. Anything below will not be viewable to staff. --- 

08/07/2025 
P004584-073025 
Samuel Sinyangwe, 
I am writing to update you on the status of your public disclosure request for Bellevue Police Department crime statistics as stated in your original request. 
Your request is still considered open and has been forwarded to the responsible department for handling. You should anticipate an additional response from our office by the end of business on 8/28/2025, if not sooner. 
If you have any questions regarding your disclosure request or any other matter, please contact the Bellevue Police Department Records Unit via the Public Records Portal or by telephone at (425) 452-6917. 
Thank you for your patience, 
Jessica Havens 
Bellevue Police Department

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Records Request :: P004584-073025
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line. Anything below will not be viewable to staff. --- 

08/22/2025 
P004584-073025 
Samuel Sinyangwe, 
The Bellevue Police Department has received your public records request for the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2024. This data should be in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If this information is not available in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide scans of the underlying use of force reports or (if unavailable) arrest reports. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Samuel Sinyangwe 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbellevue-police-department-816%252Fuse-of-force-data-2017-2024-bellevue-police-department-190352%252F%253Femail%253DBPDrecords%252540bellevuewa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAkAtzcGNrnhGpVWwBfWPi9foI%3A1uhIz9%3AMhEpSOgZOiXaIpFsoY0m7uBjXZHF7JUZ7j1BlfCKvLs 

The 1st installment of records responsive to your request are now available via the City of Bellevue Public Records Portal webpage.  Please note that pop-ups may need to be enabled on your internet browser to access your files for download . Your request is being handled on an installment basis and we predictyour next installment to be ready on or before 10/03/2025. Please be advised, the last part of the use of force data report contains juvenile information, which will need to be redacted. While we expect to be able to provide it in October, there are thousands of lines of data within the report and each case will need to be reviewed in order for us to determine which pieces of information fall under juvenile exemptions, so we may need more time. We will provide another estimated response date by 10/03/25 if we require more time. 
Pursuant to the Public Records Act RCW 42.56, responsive records may be redacted or exempt. Please review the accompanying privilege log for further information, if such redactions or exemptions have been applied. Per the State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and City Public Records Act Rules (Section 6), a public records request may be considered abandoned and subsequently closed if a requestor fails to fulfill their obligation to claim an installment of records; claim the entire production of records; inspect the records; or fails to pay the deposit or final payment for requested records within 30 days of this notification. 
If you believe the information furnished has been incorrectly redacted or is incomplete, please reach out to the assigned staff by replying to this message. Please be advised that upon closure of your request, you may file a written appeal. The appeal must include your name and address, a copy of the redacted document and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. Please mail your appeal to: 
Bellevue Police Department 
Attn: Records Supervisor 
P.O. Box 90012 
Bellevue, WA  98009-9012 
Thank you, 
Jessica Abbott 
Bellevue Police Department RPC 4.4 Inadvertent Disclosure Notification: CR 26 (b) (6) Claw Back Provision *** Please read this notice carefully *** 
Dear legal practitioner: Please take notice that we take reasonable precautions to prevent the disclosure of privileged or confidential materials, including those protected by the attorney-client privilege and/or work product doctrine, when responding to request for records.  These precautions include, but are not limited to, carefully locating and assembling responsive records, performing an intra-departmental review of the records for purposes of determining whether they contain any privileged or confidential materials, forwarding the records to the County Prosecuting Attorney's Office for independent legal review, meeting and conferring with the Prosecuting Attorney's Office to compare and reconcile any conflicting results of our separate independent reviews and, if necessary, creating a withholding log.  Despite our having taken these precautions, occasionally a mistake is made and privileged or confidential documents are inadvertently produced.  To that end, we wanted to notify you that there is a possibility that the records being produced may contain privileged or confidential materials.  The inadvertent or unintentional production of privileged or confidential documents, without a privileged or confidentiality designation should not be considered a waiver in whole or in part of any claim of privileged or confidential treatment, and any document that initially is produced without bearing a privileged or confidentiality designation may later be so designated.  In the event that you believe you have received privileged or confidential materials, we would ask that you promptly notify us of this fact and take action as necessary to comply with the obligations set forth in Rule of Professional Conduct 4.4 and/or Civil Rule 26 (b)(6).

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line. Anything below will not be viewable to staff. --- 

09/30/2025 
P004584-073025 
Samuel Sinyangwe, 
Your request is still considered open. We anticipated being able to provide you with responsive records by the end of business on 10/03/2025, but the report we are reviewing for juvenile exemptions (mostly under RCW 13.50) is over 100 pages long and we need to review each case to confirm that the subject of the report was a juvenile at the time and determine if the location of the incident is protected information (e.g., if it was also their residence). We estimate that the next installment will be ready by 12/08/2025, but you can expect an additional response by the end of business on 11/7/2025, if not sooner. 
If you have any questions regarding your disclosure request or any other matter, please contact the Bellevue Police Department Records Unit via the Public Records Portal or by telephone at (425) 452-6917. 
Thank you for your patience, 
Jessica Abbott

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line. Anything below will not be viewable to staff. --- 

11/05/2025 
P004584-073025 
Samuel Sinyangwe, 
The Bellevue Police Department has received your public records request for the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2024. This data should be in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If this information is not available in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide scans of the underlying use of force reports or (if unavailable) arrest reports. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Samuel Sinyangwe 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbellevue-police-department-816%252Fuse-of-force-data-2017-2024-bellevue-police-department-190352%252F%253Femail%253DBPDrecords%252540bellevuewa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAkAtzcGNrnhGpVWwBfWPi9foI%3A1uhIz9%3AMhEpSOgZOiXaIpFsoY0m7uBjXZHF7JUZ7j1BlfCKvLs 

The 2nd installment of records responsive to your request are now available via the City of Bellevue Public Records Portal webpage.  Please note that pop-ups may need to be enabled on your internet browser to access your files for download . Your request is being handled on an installment basis and we predictyour next installment to be ready on or before 12/19/2025. 
This report has been broken up into multiple PDFs since redactions of juvenile information are required (see page numbers in the document titles) in order to provide you with records, instead of finishing all redactions first. 
Pursuant to the Public Records Act RCW 42.56, responsive records may be redacted or exempt. Please review the accompanying privilege log for further information, if such redactions or exemptions have been applied. Per the State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and City Public Records Act Rules (Section 6), a public records request may be considered abandoned and subsequently closed if a requestor fails to fulfill their obligation to claim an installment of records; claim the entire production of records; inspect the records; or fails to pay the deposit or final payment for requested records within 30 days of this notification. 
If you believe the information furnished has been incorrectly redacted or is incomplete, please reach out to the assigned staff by replying to this message. Please be advised that upon closure of your request, you may file a written appeal. The appeal must include your name and address, a copy of the redacted document and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. Please mail your appeal to: 
Bellevue Police Department 
Attn: Records Supervisor 
P.O. Box 90012 
Bellevue, WA  98009-9012 
Thank you, 
Jessica Abbott 
Bellevue Police Department RPC 4.4 Inadvertent Disclosure Notification: CR 26 (b) (6) Claw Back Provision *** Please read this notice carefully *** 
Dear legal practitioner: Please take notice that we take reasonable precautions to prevent the disclosure of privileged or confidential materials, including those protected by the attorney-client privilege and/or work product doctrine, when responding to request for records.  These precautions include, but are not limited to, carefully locating and assembling responsive records, performing an intra-departmental review of the records for purposes of determining whether they contain any privileged or confidential materials, forwarding the records to the County Prosecuting Attorney's Office for independent legal review, meeting and conferring with the Prosecuting Attorney's Office to compare and reconcile any conflicting results of our separate independent reviews and, if necessary, creating a withholding log.  Despite our having taken these precautions, occasionally a mistake is made and privileged or confidential documents are inadvertently produced.  To that end, we wanted to notify you that there is a possibility that the records being produced may contain privileged or confidential materials.  The inadvertent or unintentional production of privileged or confidential documents, without a privileged or confidentiality designation should not be considered a waiver in whole or in part of any claim of privileged or confidential treatment, and any document that initially is produced without bearing a privileged or confidentiality designation may later be so designated.  In the event that you believe you have received privileged or confidential materials, we would ask that you promptly notify us of this fact and take action as necessary to comply with the obligations set forth in Rule of Professional Conduct 4.4 and/or Civil Rule 26 (b)(6).

12/18/2025 
P004584-073025 
Samuel Sinyangwe, 
The Bellevue Police Department has received your public records request for the following: / To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2024. This data should be in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If this information is not available in a spreadsheet or database format, please provide scans of the underlying use of force reports or (if unavailable) arrest reports. (etc.) 

Your request is still considered open. We were hoping to provide another installment of records to you today, but were only able to get 55% through the required review and redactions of the data sheet, which requires us to review each case to confirm the subject was a juvenile at the time of the incident, determine if the address listed was their residence (if so, it is protected), and determine what their involvement was (suspect, subject, victim, witness, etc.). You should anticipate an additional response by the end of business on 1/22/2026, if not sooner. 
If you have any questions regarding your disclosure request or any other matter, please contact the Bellevue Police Department Records Unit via the Public Records Portal or by telephone at (425) 452-6917. 
Thank you for your patience, 
Jessica Abbott 
Bellevue Police Department

communications.communication:

02/10/2026 P004584-073025 Samuel Sinyangwe, 
The final installment of records responsive to your request are now available via the City of Bellevue Public Records Portal website. Pop-ups may need to be enabled on your internet browser to access your files for download. This concludes our search of records in the custody of the Bellevue Police Department. This is our final, definitive response and your request is closed.  As the city does not intend to further address the request, the Public Records Act one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has now started to run. Pursuant to the Public Records Act RCW 42.56, responsive records may be redacted or exempt. Please review the accompanying privilege log for further information, if such redactions or exemptions have been applied. Per the State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and City Public Records Act Rules (Section 6), a public records request may be considered abandoned and subsequently closed if a requestor fails to fulfill their obligation to claim an installment of records; claim the entire production of records; inspect the records; or fails to pay the deposit or final payment for requested records within 30 days of this notification. Please be advised, you may file a written appeal if you believe information has been incorrectly redacted or records have been incorrectly withheld. The appeal must include your name and address, a copy of the redacted document and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. Please mail your appeal to: Bellevue Police Department 
Attn: Records Supervisor 
P.O. Box 90012 
Bellevue, WA  98009-9012 If you require any further assistance from the Bellevue Police Department regarding this matter or have questions, please contact the Records Unit via the Public Records Portal or by telephone at (425) 452-6917 within 30 days of this notification. Thank you, Jessica Abbott 
Bellevue Police Department

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Arrest records and affidavits

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Milligan

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Gregory formachelli (Fullerton Police Department)
communications.communication:

I wanted to follow up on the following California Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 8, 2019. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: 19-47 Response to Records Request
communications.communication:
Rebecca,

This is notice to you that the time to provide a response to your public records request dated 1/8/19, is extended to no later than 1/31/19, pursuant to Government Code section 6253(c), due to the need to search for, collect, and appropriately examine a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records.

Thank you,

Mea Klein
Assistant City Clerk
City of Fullerton
714-738-6571

communications.subject: 19-47 Update to Earlier Email Sent Regarding an Extension
communications.communication:
Hi Rebecca,

I apologize, in reviewing your request further, it was determined that the extension notice sent was in error.

We will need clarification regarding your request for records.  You requested: "Arrest records and affidavits."  Your request is overly broad and lacking specifics.  Can you please clarify your request?

Thank you,

Mea Klein
Assistant City Clerk
City of Fullerton
714-738-6571

communications.subject: 19-47 Response to records request
communications.communication:
Rebecca,

The City is in the process of reviewing and appropriately redacting and preparing for production the records responsive to your request.  We anticipate that the records will be available no later than 5:00 p.m. on March 4, 2019. We will let you know as soon as the records are available.


Mea Klein
Assistant City Clerk
City of Fullerton
714-738-6571

communications.subject: Re: Production Status of SB 1421 Files
communications.communication:
Dear SB1421 Requesters and interested parties,

It has come to my attention that the City of Fullerton has broken California’s Public Record’s Law, specifically related to SB1421, by denying you records which are quite clearly publicly disclosable.

In the link sent to you by Mea Klein, Assistant City Clerk, as provided to her by the City Attorney, you were told that there are 27 Officers "REQUESTED BY NAME, BUT NO DISCLOSABLE FILE AVAILABLE (27)”. This is patently false.

The City of Fullerton is currently suing me, my compatriot David and the blog Friends for Fullerton’s Future directly related to the findings on several of these officers.

https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/2019/city-of-fullerton-is-suing-me-and-this-blog/ <https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/2019/city-of-fullerton-is-suing-me-and-this-blog/>

In looking at this list I can quite easily name Officers on that list who have disclosable records under SB1421 including but not limited to Kathryn Hamel, Paul Irish, Miguel “Sonny” Siliceo, Christopher Wren & Nathan Roesler.

A sustained finding was found against Hamel and one cannot simply unring that bell as seen in the recent Contra Costa County tentative decision (CASE NAME: RICHMOND POLICE VS. CITY OF RICHMOND <https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Contra-Costa-Ruling-Case-MSN19-0169-2020-07-31.pdf>). 

This FFFF article related to Hamel is specifically mentioned in the lawsuit against myself and FFFF:

https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/2019/fullerton-police-cut-a-deal-to-bypass-the-law/ <https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/2019/fullerton-police-cut-a-deal-to-bypass-the-law/>

Christopher Wren had a sustained finding against for dishonesty related to a workplace affair with a subordinate. In IA Case #17-0038 one of the sustained findings against Officer Wren is as follows:

“6. On December 17, 2017, when Lieutenant Cleggett asked you about your whereabouts, you dishonestly stated to Lieutenant Cleggett that you had been on the phone with your wife the entire time and did not notice Lieutenant Cleggett’s text message.”

This statement of dishonesty was directly related to misconduct as outlined in the timeline of Wren’s activities and being in violation of policy. 

Likewise with Christopher Wren, this article is specifically listed in the lawsuit being waged against myself and FFFF:

https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/2019/what-happened-to-officer-christopher-wren/

The idea that the city attorney is unaware of the sustained findings against their officers which are disclosable under SB1421 is laughable when those very stories are being used by the same attorneys as evidence in a lawsuit where the city seeks a prior restraint against myself and FFFF.

The blog has likewise published stories on how Paul Irish was terminated for dishonesty;

https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/2019/fullertons-veritable-serpico-problem/ <https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/2019/fullertons-veritable-serpico-problem/>

Miguel “Sonny” Siliceo admitted in the plea deal that he both used excessive force and falsified a police report.

https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/2018/sonnys-admission-guilt/ <https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/2018/sonnys-admission-guilt/>

Nathan Roesler filed a false report with the City of Placentia which resulted in an innocent man being arrested for a crime that wasn’t committed against Roesler. This was referred to the District Attorney for prosecution.

https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/2018/another-possible-cover-up-by-fpd/ <https://www.fullertonsfuture.org/2018/another-possible-cover-up-by-fpd/>

These are the cases which are readily and easily pointed out which I believe to be disclosable under SB1421 which calls all of the other officers on the list into question. The City is blatantly lying to you, your organizations and agencies as well as the public and concerned entities about disclosable records despite being in a separate lawsuit over these very violations of SB1421.

They are likewise violating the law in regards to the officer whose records are "PENDING; NOT YET PRODUCED (3)”. The incident in Corbett’s case was from 2016 and Paez’s was in 2017. The timeline has long passed for required production in both of these cases.

If you are honestly seeking these records and others from the City of Fullerton you will likely have no recourse but to seek remedies in order to get to the truth. I have already been forced to take this route unfortunately.

Thank you for your time and I wish you all the best in your efforts.

Sincerely,

Joshua Ferguson
Host, The Hourly Struggle
Writer, Friends for Fullerton’s Future
Concerned Citizen

communications.subject: Fullerton Production Status of SB 1421 Files
communications.communication:
Dear SB 1421 requesters and interested parties:
You have each recently received a mass email communication from an individual with whom the City of Fullerton is currently engaged in civil litigation, Joshua Ferguson.  The email contained inaccuracies about the City's responses to Public Records requests.  The City would like to correct certain information and assure you and other members of the public of its commitment to transparency and compliance with legal requirements for the disclosure of public records, including certain peace officer records recently made public under SB 1421, which is codified at Penal Code section 832.7.  Of course, the City cannot respond as to any specifics about any individual officers referenced, due to privacy.

Disclosable use of force files:
Not all use of force investigation files are disclosable under SB 1421.  SB 1421 only allows the disclosure of those files involving uses of force that have resulted in death or "great bodily injury."  Pen. Code section 832.7(b)(1)(A)(ii).  "Great bodily injury" means "significant or substantial physical injury."  Pen. Code section 16600.  Examples of "great bodily injury" include: broken bones, People v. Villarreal (1985) 173 Cal.App.3d 1136, 1141; gunshot wounds, People v. Mendias (1993) 17 Cal.App.4th 195; and a dog bite, People v. Frazier (2009) 173 Cal. App. 4th 613, 618.  SB 1421 also mandates the disclosure of investigation files involving a peace officer or custodial officer's discharge of a firearm at a civilian.  See Pen. Code section 832.7(b)(1)(A)(i).

Disclosable dishonesty files:
Not all dishonesty investigation files are disclosable under SB 1421.  SB 1421 only allows the disclosure of "sustained finding[s] . . . [of] dishonesty by a peace officer or custodial officer directly relating to the reporting, investigation, or prosecution of a crime, or directly relating to the reporting of, or investigation of misconduct by, another peace officer or custodial officer, including but not limited to, any sustained finding of perjury, false statements, filing false reports, destruction, falsifying, or concealing of evidence."  See Cal. Penal Code section 832.7(b)(1)(C) (emphasis added).
The Legislature intended to provide the public access to cases involving dishonesty, where an officer "is proven to have planted evidence, committed perjury, or otherwise been dishonest in the reporting, investigation, or prosecution of a crime."  Assembly Committee on Public Safety, Analysis of SB 1421 (June 26, 2018).

In order for acts of dishonesty to be disclosable under SB 1421, there must also have been a "sustained" finding of dishonesty.  A "sustained finding" is defined as "a final determination by an investigating agency, commission, board, hearing officer, or arbitrator, as applicable, following an investigation and opportunity for an administrative appeal pursuant to Sections 3304 and 3304.5 of the Government Code, that the actions of the peace officer or custodial officer were found to violate law or department policy."  Pen. Code section 832.8 (emphasis added).

If an officer investigated for the type dishonesty or sexual assault that is disclosable under SB 1421 resigns prior to a sustained finding, his or her file is not disclosable.

Although the email that you received referred to a specific court ruling (Richmond Police Officers' Ass'n v. City of Richmond), that ruling was only tentative (not final) and was only the ruling of one Superior Court Judge in Contra Costa County.  The City of Fullerton is located in Orange County, and is not subject to those courts or their rulings.  However, even a ruling in Orange County would not have been determinative, as facts in different cases may lead to different results, and a single judge's opinion is not required to be followed by other judges, until there is some binding opinion of higher courts.  In fact, in City of Richmond, that court found that the employer and an officer could not reverse sustained findings of dishonesty or sexual assault through a negotiated settlement, after the conclusion of a formal hearing process.  In circumstances where a final, formal hearing has not been held, the court acknowledged that there would be no "sustained findings" and hence such records are "not disclosable under SB 1421."  (The City of Richmond court also noted that investigations of dishonesty involving subjects not specifically listed in Penal Code section 832.7 are also not disclosable).

Regardless of the inapplicability of the City of Richmond opinion in Orange County, the City of Fullerton's disclosure of its records under SB 1421 does follow the same principles.

The City is committed to providing all records that it is required and permitted to release to the public relating to peace officers.  It has been working hard to review and release all records newly made releasable since the enactment of SB 1421, and will continue to do so. The City has produced 26 SB 1421 files; has partially produced 13 additional SB 1421 files; and has 2 SB 1421 files pending review (one of which awaits resolution of administrative or other proceedings).  The City's SB 1421 productions are available at www.cityoffullerton.com/sb1421<http://www.cityoffullerton.com/sb1421>, and a copy of the summary chart detailing the progress of the City's SB 1421 review and production is posted therein.

If you have any questions or concerns about your requests or the City's production thereto, please contact the City Clerk's Office or the City Attorney's Office.

Kimberly Hall Barlow
Jones & Mayer
3777 N. Harbor Boulevard
Fullerton, California 92835
714-446-1400 Telephone
714-446-1448 Facsimile
khb@jones-mayer.com<mailto:khb@jones-mayer.com>

This electronic transmission, and any documents attached hereto, may contain confidential and/or legally privileged information. The information is intended for the sole use of the recipient named above. If you have received this electronic message in error, please notify the sender and delete the electronic message. Any disclosure, copying, distribution, or use of the contents of this information received in error is strictly prohibited.

Disclaimer

The information contained in this communication from the sender is confidential. It is intended solely for use by the recipient and others authorized to receive it. If you are not the recipient, you are hereby notified that any disclosure, copying, distribution or taking action in relation of the contents of this information is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful.

title: Christian Manor & Christian Tower Records Request

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Christian Manor & Christian Tower Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

For Christian Manor & Christian Tower, located at 138 E Franklin Street & 143 Prince Street, Gallatin, TN 37066. Please provide the following information:

Certificates of Occupancy: Please provide any copies of the Certificate of Occupancy on file. If there are none available, please state the reason for their absence, and whether the lack of COs would give rise to any enforcement action or constitute a code violation.
 
Approved Site Plan and/or Conditions of Approval, if applicable: Are there any available approval documents on file, such as planned development documents, variances, special use permits, exceptions, site-specific resolution/conditions of approval? Please provide any copies. Was this property subject to any site plan approval? Please provide any copies

Zoning Code Violations: Please provide notice and summary of any open/outstanding zoning code violations, or confirmation that none currently exist.

Building Code Violations:  Please provide notice and summary of any open/outstanding building code violations, or confirmation that none currently exist.

Fire Code Violations:  Please provide notice and summary of any open/outstanding fire code violations, or confirmation that none currently exist.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Grace Mosteller.

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Douglas County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Nebraska Public Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Douglas County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nebraska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: Gerald Edward Connolly (March 30, 1950 – May 21, 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Gerald Edward Connolly (March 30, 1950 – May 21, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Congressman Gerald Edward Connolly (March 30, 1950 – May 21, 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his Fox News obituary at the following link: https://www.foxnews.com/politics/virginia-democratic-rep-gerry-connolly-dead-75

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1669654-000
communications.communication:
To whom this may concern,

I hope this message finds you well. My name is Matthew Petti and I am writing with regard to my FOIA request number 1669654-000 for records on Gerald Edward Connolly (March 30, 1950 – May 21, 2025). In a response letter dated June 25, 2025, the Bureau wrote that "additional records potentially responsive to your subject may exist. If this release of previously processed material does not satisfy your request, you may request an additional search for records."

I am writing to request an additional search for records.

Thank you,
Matthew Petti

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Livingston County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Livingston County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.communication:
RE: Public Safety: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request created on January 29, 2026, Reference # R000103-012926 
Dear Samuel , 
The Livingston County received a public records request from you on January 29, 2026. You requested the following: 
"To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Samuel Sinyangwe 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2202275/" 
Our procedure is to locate records, review them for exemptions, and then prepare them for your inspection and/or copying. The undersigned will be coordinating with other Livingston County departments in the collection, review and production of responsive records. 
We are extending the date to respond to your FOIA request for no more than 10 business days, until 2/23/2026. Only one extension may be taken per FOIA request. This time frame estimate is nonbinding upon the County, but the County is providing the estimate in good faith. Providing an estimated time frame does not relieve a public body from any of the other requirements of this act. 
In the event you are not satisfied with this response, I want to advise you of your rights. You have the right to submit a written appeal to the Livingston County Board of Commissioners, which specifically states the word “appeal” and identifies the reason. 
Thank you for your patience in awaiting this information. 
Sincerely, 
Leslie Stidham 
Central Records Specialist • Sheriff

title: Dean Reed

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Dean Reed
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry of Dean Cyril Reed (September 22, 1938 - June 13, 1986). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/1986/06/19/obituaries/dean-reed-dies-at-47-us-expatriate-singer.html Two file numbers are potentially associated with Reed: 100-HQ-437976 and 100-LA-63079.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: Request for Public Records # 26-031
communications.communication:
The City is in receipt of your Public Records Act request (Request # 26-031), received on January 23, 2026.

The City intends to cooperate to the fullest extent possible with the Public Records Act ("PRA") (Government Code section 7920.000 et seq.). Under established California law, the City is obliged to comply with a request for a public record so long as the requester makes a specific and focused request for information, that information is maintained by the City in its ordinary course of business, the information is disclosable, and the record can be located with reasonable effort.  The PRA provides for the inspection or copying of existing identifiable public records; it does not compel the City to respond directly to questions or create new records, lists, or reports in response to a request.

 The City has conducted a search and determined that it has no responsive records to your request. With this response, the City considers your request complete. If you have any questions about this request, please feel free to reach out.

Respectfully,


[cid:image001.jpg@01DC945C.2657C2A0]
Julia Gautho, CMC
City Clerk
City of Capitola   |  420 Capitola Ave.  |  Capitola CA 95010
(831) 475-7300  |   jgautho@ci.capitola.ca.us<mailto:jgautho@ci.capitola.ca.us>  |  cityofcapitola.org  <cityofcapitola.org>

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Capitola Revised Flock Contract
communications.communication:
.

February 2, 2026

Syd Jones
203046-58824598@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:203046-58824598@requests.muckrock.com>

RE: CPRA Request #26-031, January 23, 2026 – Flock Contract Amendment

The City of Capitola (“City”) is in receipt of your Public Records Act request (“Request”) dated January 23, 2026, seeking “amended contract with Flock Safety.”

The City intends to cooperate to the fullest extent possible with the Public Records Act (“PRA”) (Government Code section 7920.000 et seq.). Under established California law, the City is obliged to comply with a request for a public record so long as the requestor makes a specific and focused request for information, the City maintains that information in its ordinary course of business, the information is disclosable, and the record can be located with reasonable effort. The PRA provides for the inspection or copying of existing identifiable public records; it does not compel the City to respond directly to questions or create new records, lists, or reports in response to a request.

After a diligent search, the City has determined that it does not possess records responsive to your Request.

With this letter, the City considers your Request closed. If you have any questions regarding the City’s response or would like to discuss your Request please contact me at thernandez@ci.capitola.ca.us<mailto:thernandez@ci.capitola.ca.us>.




[cid:image001.png@01DC967A.C9925820]
Tracie Hernandez
Police Records & Evidence Manager

title: Oklahoma HHS response

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the Oklahoma State Department of Health remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf.

I also request internal communications between any Oklahoma State Department of Health employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed.

I additionally request that, if possible, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

title: Communications Involving the Kids Online Safety Act, SCREEN Act, and Foreign NGO Policy Influence

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications Involving the Kids Online Safety Act, SCREEN Act, and Foreign NGO Policy Influence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from January 1, 2022, to the present, including but not limited to:

1.Communications, internal memoranda, policy drafts, meeting notes, or advisories related to:
- a)The Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA)
- b)The SCREEN Act
- c)Any U.S. age verification or online child safety policy proposals.

2.Communications or documents involving the following organizations:
- a)National Center on Sexual Exploitation (NCOSE)
- b)Collective Shout
- c)CEASE (Centre to End All Sexual Exploitation)
- d)Carnegie UK Trust
- e)Yoti (digital ID software provider)

3.Any communications with or internal responses to foreign regulators (e.g., Ofcom, European Commission) related to:
- a)The Online Safety Act (UK)
- b)The Digital Services Act (DSA) (EU)
- c)Impacts on U.S. tech companies or policymaking.

This request is submitted with reference to the July 25, 2025 Interim Staff Report of the U.S. House Judiciary Committee titled:
“The Foreign Censorship Threat: How the European Union’s Digital Services Act Compels Global Censorship and Infringes on American Free Speech.”

This report documents concerns that foreign laws are being used to impose domestic censorship goals through indirect means. This FOIA request seeks to determine whether similar tactics were employed by the aforementioned NGOs or agencies.

I request a waiver of fees as this is in the public interest. I am submitting this on behalf of Alathea LLC.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Demosthenes Alathea

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications Involving the Kids Online Safety Act, SCREEN Act, and Foreign NGO Policy Influence
communications.communication:
Dear Demosthenes,

Thank you for the submission. However, it cannot be processed for the following reason(s):


  *   Request is overly broad (overbreadth issues).

Under longstanding FOIA precedents, “broad sweeping requests lacking specificity are not permissible.” Marks v. United States (Dep’t of Justice), 578 F.2d 261, 263 (9 Cir. 1978), see also, (“Request is too broad which seeks ‘all unpublished manuscripts decisions of the Patent Office, together with such indices as are available.” Irons v. Schuyler, 151 U.S App. D.C 23(1972)). See also, OSTP’s regulation that reads, in pertinent part:


  *   A request must describe the records sought in sufficient detail to enable OSTP personnel to locate the records with a reasonable amount of effort. To the extent possible, a requester should include specific information that may assist OSTP personnel in identifying the requested records, such as the date, title or name, author, recipient, and subject matter of the record. In general, a requester should include as much detail as possible about the specific records or the types of records sought. 32 C.F.R.§2402.4(b).

Thus, the request needs to be amended to identify the custodian(s) for the records mentioned herein. For instance, the request could be amended as follows:

All communications to or from OSTP’s former Director, Dr. Arati Prabhakar, and current Director, Michael Kratisios, regarding

“- a)The Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA)
- b)The SCREEN Act
- c)Any U.S. age verification or online child safety policy proposals.”

- a)National Center on Sexual Exploitation (NCOSE)
- b)Collective Shout
- c)CEASE (Centre to End All Sexual Exploitation)
- d)Carnegie UK Trust
- e)Yoti (digital ID software provider)


- a)The Online Safety Act (UK)
- b)The Digital Services Act (DSA) (EU)
- c)Impacts on U.S. tech companies or policymaking.”

The responsive timeframe is January 1, 2022, to the present.

Additionally, the request could be amended as follows:

All communications between OSTP’s former Director, Dr. Arati Prabhakar, and current Director, Michael Kratisios, and Ofcom and the European Commission regarding

a)The Online Safety Act (UK)
- b)The Digital Services Act (DSA) (EU)
- c)Impacts on U.S. tech companies or policymaking

The responsive timeframe is January 1, 2022, to the present.

Those are examples of permissible requests.

Please let us know how you would like to proceed.
Regards,

OSTP FOIA Office.

communications.subject: RE: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications Involving the Kids Online Safety Act, SCREEN Act, and Foreign NGO Policy Influence
communications.communication:
Subject: Amended FOIA Request – OSTP – Communications Involving the Kids Online Safety Act, SCREEN Act, and Foreign NGO Policy Influence

Dear OSTP FOIA Office,

This is an amended request under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. I am reformatting my prior request in a narrower and more specific form, as suggested by your office as well as updated information.

Timeframe:
January 1, 2022 – present

Custodians:
Please search the records of the following OSTP officials during their respective tenures:
- Eric Lander - OSTP Director (June 2, 2021 - February 18, 2022)
- Alondra Nelson - Acting OSTP Director (February 18, 2022 - October 3, 2022)
- Arati Prabhakar - OSTP Director (October 3, 2022 - January 20, 2025)
- Michael Kratsios - OSTP Director (March 25, 2025 - present)

Records Requested:

1. Communications regarding U.S. policy proposals

All communications (including emails, memos, meeting notes, or attachments) sent to or from the above custodians regarding:
a) The Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA)
b) The SCREEN Act
c) The EARN IT Act
d) The Interstate Obscenity Definition Act (IODA)
e) The App Store Accountability Act
f) COPPA 2.0 (Children and Teens’ Online Privacy Protection Act)

2. Communications with NGOs and private organizations

All communications between the above custodians and the following organizations:
a) National Center on Sexual Exploitation (NCOSE)
b) International Centre for Missing & Exploited Children (ICMEC)
c) WeProtect Global Alliance
d) Collective Shout (Australia)
e) Yoti (digital ID software provider)
f) Age Verification Providers Association (AVPA)
g) Mastercard International, specifically its 'Digital Identity Service' initiatives
h) Family Online Safety Institute (FOSI)

3. Communications with foreign regulators

All communications between the above custodians and the following entities:
a) Ofcom (United Kingdom)
b) The European Commission (European Union)
c) Australia’s eSafety Commissioner, Julie Inman Grant
regarding:
- The Online Safety Act (UK)
- The Digital Services Act (EU)
- Australia’s Online Safety framework
- Impacts on U.S. technology companies or U.S. policymaking

Format:
I am willing to accept all records in electronic form (PDFs via email).

Fee Category / Public Interest:
This request is filed via MuckRock News, a recognized FOIA filing and publication platform. All responsive documents will be made automatically available to the general public at a permanent, free-to-access URL. As such, this request is not being made for commercial purposes. The primary purpose is to inform the public about government operations and policy influences in this area.

Thank you for your assistance, and please let me know if further narrowing is necessary.

Sincerely,
Demosthenes Alathea

OSTP FOIA Office.

On Jan. 6, 2026:
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications Involving the Kids Online Safety Act, SCREEN Act, and Foreign NGO Policy Influence
Dear Demosthenes,

The first interim production letter as well as the first 150 pages of the total production of 971 pages are attached. The remaining records will be sent through multiple emails due to file size restrictions. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.

Thank you.
Regards,

OSTP FOIA Office.
---

On Dec. 2, 2025:
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications Involving the Kids Online Safety Act, SCREEN Act, and Foreign NGO Policy Influence
Dear Demosthenes,

Thank you for the inquiry. The request is still being processed and updates will be provided as they become available.

NOTE: Processing times might be longer than expected due to the recent lapse in appropriations. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.
Regards,

OSTP FOIA Office.
---

On Dec. 1, 2025:
Subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications Involving the Kids Online Safety Act, SCREEN Act, and Foreign NGO Policy Influence
Dear Demosthenes,

Thank you for the inquiry. Please note that we are still processing the requests that were received ahead of the instant one. Additionally, the recent lapse in appropriations might also impact the processing timeframe for FOIA requests. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.
Regards,

OSTP FOIA Office.
---

On Aug. 7, 2025:
Subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications Involving the Kids Online Safety Act, SCREEN Act, and Foreign NGO Policy Influence
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from January 1, 2022, to the present, including but not limited to:

1.Communications, internal memoranda, policy drafts, meeting notes, or advisories related to:
- a)The Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA)
- b)The SCREEN Act
- c)Any U.S. age verification or online child safety policy proposals.

2.Communications or documents involving the following organizations:
- a)National Center on Sexual Exploitation (NCOSE)
- b)Collective Shout
- c)CEASE (Centre to End All Sexual Exploitation)
- d)Carnegie UK Trust
- e)Yoti (digital ID software provider)

3.Any communications with or internal responses to foreign regulators (e.g., Ofcom, European Commission) related to:
- a)The Online Safety Act (UK)
- b)The Digital Services Act (DSA) (EU)
- c)Impacts on U.S. tech companies or policymaking.

This request is submitted with reference to the July 25, 2025 Interim Staff Report of the U.S. House Judiciary Committee titled:
“The Foreign Censorship Threat: How the European Union’s Digital Services Act Compels Global Censorship and Infringes on American Free Speech.”

This report documents concerns that foreign laws are being used to impose domestic censorship goals through indirect means. This FOIA request seeks to determine whether similar tactics were employed by the aforementioned NGOs or agencies.

I request a waiver of fees as this is in the public interest. I am submitting this on behalf of Alathea LLC.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Demosthenes Alathea

View request history, upload responsive documents, and report problems here:
https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2202442/

Filed via MuckRock.com
E-mail (Preferred): 190722-41971486@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:190722-41971486@requests.muckrock.com>

PLEASE NOTE OUR NEW ADDRESS
For mailed responses, please address (see note):
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 190722
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

PLEASE NOTE: This request is not filed by a MuckRock staff member, but is being sent through MuckRock by the above in order to better track, share, and manage public records requests. Also note that improperly addressed (i.e., with the requester's name rather than "MuckRock News" and the department number) requests might be returned as undeliverable.
